newsitem.title: USA: Silicon Gaming slot approved for field test.
newsitem.headline: Silicon Gaming slot approved for field test.

text.p: Silicon Gaming Corp said Tuesday a Nevada gambling authority approved its video slot machine for field testing, the last big regulatory hurdle before the company can sell its product.

The Nevada Gaming Control Board notified the Palo Alto, Calif.-based maker of software-based slot machines that it can begin a 60-day field trial of the Odyssey, the company's chief product, Silicon Gaming said.
The field trial begins Friday at Bally Entertainment Corp's Bally's Resort and Casino in Las Vegas.
If the Odyssey met performance standards, the company could begin shipping the slot machine to customers for evaluation as early as March, said Tom Carlson, Silicon Gaming chief financial officer.
Silicon Gaming shares rose 1/4 to 16-1/8 in midafternoon Nasdaq trading.

The company has commitments for evaluations for 550 units from 26 top casino operators, Carlson said. Pending gaming board and customer approval, Silicon Gaming will begin reporting revenue as early as May or June 1997, Carlson said.
The Odyssey is a slot machine that uses a video screen instead of mechanical reels. The machine's software lets casino operators change the game's format quickly to suit gamblers' tastes.
